name: Client
description: Functions that interact with Minecraft that don't fit into their own module. Accessible from scripts via the global `Client` variable.

methods.name: getMinecraft
methods.description: The raw Minecraft client instance. This provides raw access to the MinecraftClient java class. On fabric, methods, fields, and classes can be accessed via their intermediary names (ex. method_29043). If the minecraft version is 1.21.11 or beyond, they can be accessed via their unobfuscated Mojang names.

methods.name: getRegistryManager
methods.description: A helper for interacting with Minecraft's registry.

methods.name: createPacketByteBuffer
methods.description: A helper to create, modify, and send Minecraft packets.

methods.name: runOnMainThread
methods.signature: Client.runOnMainThread(runnable: MethodWrapper(), await?: boolean, watchdogMaxTime?: long)
methods.description: The task to run on the main Minecraft thread.

parameters.name: runnable
parameters.description: The task to run on the main Minecraft thread.

parameters.name: await
parameters.description: If `true`, blocks the script until the task is completed.

parameters.name: watchdogMaxTime
parameters.description: The maximum time in milliseconds for the watchdog to wait before killing the script if it becomes unresponsive.

methods.name: getGameOptions
methods.description: A helper which gives access to all game options.

methods.name: mcVersion
methods.description: The current Minecraft version.

methods.name: getFPS
methods.description: The FPS debug string from Minecraft.

methods.name: loadWorld
methods.description: The folder name of the singleplayer world to join.

parameters.name: folderName
parameters.description: The folder name of the singleplayer world to join.

methods.name: connect
methods.description: The IP address of the server.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: The IP address of the server.

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: A function to call after disconnecting. The function receives a boolean indicating if the disconnection was successful.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call after disconnecting. The function receives a boolean indicating if the disconnection was successful.

methods.name: shutdown
methods.description: Closes the client (stops the game). This method waits until the game has stopped, meaning no further code in the script is executed. This does not wait on joined threads, so your script may stop at an undefined point.
examples: // No more code will be executed

methods.name: waitTick
methods.description: The number of client ticks to wait. If run from the main thread, this will throw an IllegalThreadStateException.

parameters.name: ticks
parameters.description: The number of client ticks to wait.

methods.name: ping
methods.description: Information about the server, or `null` if the ping fails.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: The IP address of the server to ping.

methods.name: pingAsync
methods.signature: Client.pingAsync(ip: string, callback: MethodWrapper(serverInfo: ServerInfoHelper, error: IOException))
methods.description: A function to call with the result.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: The IP address of the server to ping.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call with the result.

methods.name: cancelAllPings
methods.description: Cancels any ongoing pings started with `pingAsync` or `ping` if called from another thread.

methods.name: getLoadedMods
methods.description: A list of all loaded mods.

methods.name: isModLoaded
methods.description: `true` if the mod is loaded, `false` otherwise.

parameters.name: modId
parameters.description: The ID of the mod to check.

methods.name: getMod
methods.description: The mod container for the given mod ID, or `null` if not found.

parameters.name: modId
parameters.description: The ID of the mod to get.

methods.name: grabMouse
methods.description: Makes Minecraft believe that the mouse is currently inside the window. This will also automatically set the "Pause on Lost Focus" option to `false`.

methods.name: isDevEnv
methods.description: `true` if running in a development environment, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: getModLoader
methods.description: The name of the mod loader (e.g., "Fabric", "Forge").
examples:
const loader = Client.getModLoader();
Chat.log(`Mod loader: ${loader}`); // e.g., "Fabric"

methods.name: getRegisteredBlocks
methods.description: A list of all registered blocks as `BlockHelper` objects.
examples:
const blocks = Client.getRegisteredBlocks();
Chat.log(`There are ${blocks.size()} registered blocks.`);

methods.name: getRegisteredItems
methods.description: A list of all registered items as `ItemHelper` objects.
examples:
const items = Client.getRegisteredItems();
Chat.log(`There are ${items.size()} registered items.`);

methods.name: exitGamePeacefully
methods.description: Tries to close the game gracefully, as if the player clicked the "Quit Game" button.

methods.name: exitGameForcefully
methods.description: Forcefully terminates the game process.

methods.name: sendPacket
methods.description: The packet to send to the server.

parameters.name: packet
parameters.description: The packet to send to the server.

methods.name: receivePacket
methods.description: The packet to be processed by the client.

parameters.name: packet
parameters.description: The packet to be processed by the client.
